title: New York Subway Shooting Suspect in Custody; Police said suspect Andrew Abdullah turned himself in
text:
The shooting occurred Sunday just before noon on a Q train as it crossed the Manhattan Bridge on its way to the Canal Street station in Manhattan, police said. The victim was 48-year-old Daniel Enriquez of Brooklyn, who died at a nearby hospital Sunday.

Police said Mr. Enriquez was in the last car of the train when a man who had been pacing back and forth pulled out a gun and shot him at close range. The two men had no interaction before the shooting, witnesses told police. None of the other riders in the car were wounded.

Mr. Enriquez worked in the research division at Goldman Sachs Group Inc., joining the bank in 2013.

It was the second attack on the nation's largest subway system in weeks. Last month, a man opened fire on a Brooklyn subway train during morning rush hour, injuring 10 people in the attack. Thirteen others were treated for smoke inhalation, panic attacks or falls.

The suspected gunman in that incident, 62-year-old Frank James, was taken into custody after a 30-hour manhunt. Mr. James faces a terrorism charge and possible life in prison, federal prosecutors said. He has pleaded not guilty.

Write to Joseph Pisani at joseph.pisani@wsj.com

New York Subway Shooting Suspect in Custody
